title: Great Company
pros: Great culture on our team
cons: Not a lot of activity in terms of acquisitions.

title: Not a good company at all
pros: Pay is great, Benefits are good

title: Leasing Agent
pros: the commission was the only bonus
cons:
no work life balance 
missing funds

title: Lipstick on a pig
pros: Pay, PTO, hybrid schedule, as always, the people to the left and right are great.
cons: C-suite— mainly the COO. The rest just fall inline and do as the master says. Since she joined, she brought a soulless approach to people mgmt., nepotism, and immaturity. Most companies mean what they say but all of the trending employment key words are just words to please the investors and board. Policies are not current and legacy culture is being torn apart. What Elme (spelled El Me but pronounced (Elm) was known as WASH REIT. That company brought a good company culture and since the transition to Elme — it’s quickly being changed to a mo yea first, people last, and cut throat business.

title: Doesn’t Support Staff
pros: Salary higher than most companies
cons: Doesn’t support staff in GA. Instead of brainstorming ways to improve the portfolio they find a reason to let you go

title: Special team, Special time. Special players.
pros: Lots of flexibility around hours. Colleagues are great.
cons: Office moved out of DC to Bethesda.

title: Fake “Leadership”
pros: their leadership is more like a small family run business. If you’re not a favorite or listen to them talk, you’re not “family.”
cons: The titles most people have are not equivalent to the real world/normal professional businesses.

title: Great Company
pros: Small team with plenty of areas to help/gain experience in
cons: none so far has been a con.

title: Good place to work
pros: Great benefits and people to work with.
cons: Older demographic to work with.

title: Growing Company with lots of opportunity
pros: Great people to work with very collaborative
cons: Fast paced environment with no processes in place but they are working towards streamlining things. Longer hours of work until then.

title: Don’t work here.
pros: There are none. Terrible company.
cons: Unorganized. Insufferable. Many layoffs. This company bit off more than it could chew.

title: Good benefits, struggling company
pros: Family culture, flexible work schedule, good benefits
cons: Employees rarely are promoted, executives do not push for results and rarely challenge the status quo.

title: Regarding Aug 13 post clearly someone in marketing.
pros: None really, sorry. Unless your and executive with a contract that will pay you for years after they lay you off.
cons: Trust is their last name, but it is the last thing you will get as an employee and the last thing you should do as an employee. So the facts, in the last year people who have spent a career of 20 plus years building the company have been let go. Then they start out-sourcing everything from leasing, architecture, and recently even management. Only the Executives with their golden parachutes are the priority at this company, read the SEC documents and if interviewing ask how many people have been laid off / let go in the last few years due to a new strategy! Soon all that will be left are a few executives with sweet compensation packages and third party service providers. Look at the quarterly reports, after dropping dividend they are still paying out more than they take in, not a winning formula! No growth in stock, stuck with perdominatly older office space that is struggling and can't compete agains all the new buildings, and selling off of divisions. Yeah ask questions and tread lightly.

title: Positive & Energetic Work Environment w/ Endless Career Potential
pros: Washington REIT provides a fast paced work environment for motivated individuals who are passionate and excited about their work. I’ve found the leadership to be inspiring and I would consider the company to have a collaborative open door policy. As the oldest publicly traded REIT in the country, the firm had a reputation for taking on that persona - until recently. That being said, I firmly believe that both the new CEO and new COO have done an excellent job at reversing the firm’s reputation in the industry and delivering bottom line results to investors that are attributable to the firm’s strategic direction and growth.
cons: None – it remains to be seen.

title: Best career choice I've ever made
pros: I've been at WashREIT for nearly a year. Everything from the interview process to the culture, to the teamwork and community have been outstanding. Even in this short time, I have learned so much and gained such incredible value from working with this dedicated team. WashREIT actually lives its core values - you have a voice, you're encouraged to lead, and you are motivated to excel. I am very blessed to be part of such an outstanding organization.
cons: With the complexity of the industry, there are many applications and services to learn about when coming on board. I think expanding the onboarding experience to educate people about these various systems would be beneficial in the long term.

title: Outstanding leadership
pros: The folks on the executive team are very thoughtful about the vision they have for the company and how they implement it. Transparent environment / lots of integrity from leadership. They're focused on doing what's right for the people. No hierarchy or bureaucracy, just a place where everyone collaborates and feels valued, and all ideas are welcomed and respected. HR dept. is incredible and unlike any I've seen, at other companies you'd need to spend $$$ externally to get the same level of professional coaching. Another huge plus is that the IT department is top notch and they constantly strive to make everyone's job easier and faster.
cons: None that I've encountered so far.

title: How many folks over 50 years of age are you going to let go?
pros: None really. Got paid on time and had a fair amount of vacation Very old boy like.
cons: The last more than ten people let go have been over 50. Ceo is unapproachable. HR should be one director not two. Benefits good but health insurance ridiculously expensive. Stuffy atmosphere unlike when the former ceo was their. People scared about more layoffs.

title: Bad.
pros: For me none. Have been picked on and abuse...
cons: Race and orientation, Benefits have been good. Time off has been good. Policies need to be reviewed.

title: Great Company
pros: A leadership team that cares about their employees, opportunities for hands-on learning, inclusive and collaborative culture, dynamic community service that supports our local community, a company that supports environmental sustainability
cons: There are many opportunities to learn and grow, but at times you need to take the initiative to reach out and find them

title: Solid organization with hardworking, dedicated employees.
pros: Repectful environment, execs are accessible and fair minded. The company owns a diverse portfolio which is unique to peers. Company benefits are excellent, friendly environment, fast-paced.
cons: Since it's a public company, there is a fair amount of financial reporting required.

title: Bureaucratic, indecisive and redundant work environment.
pros: Great employees to work with, people are kind.
cons: Too much bureaucracy, paper pushing, and employee paranoia about job security within the company. Excessive and pointless reports required from all employees - too much redundant positions in the company.

title: Chief Engineer
pros: Good Pay, growing company, good peers to work around
cons: Top Heavy management, some facets of management are micro managed

title: Director
pros: Great organization, collaborative environment, great co-workers.
cons: Changes in company strategy was difficult for many long term team members.

title: A great company to work .
pros: -Great co-workers -Training opportunity -Great leadership -Opportunity for personal development
cons: not any that I can think of . Great Experience .

title: Culture
pros: WashREIT is an innovative and forward thinking company. Leadership is smart and they make themselves accessible to all employees
cons: The company lacks diversity within their line and senior staff levels.

title: Commercial Real Estate Management
pros: Good pay, benefits, location, work environment, holidays
cons: Reorganization caused several job loss

title: Worked for 4plus years

cons: Company downsized, management, vision, and culture changed.

title: A great company to work for

cons: Residential buildings only, now. Sold off office portfolio.

pros: Large Reit has properties centrally located
cons: No growth potential - expensive benefits

title: Nice company.

title: Assistant Property Manager

cons: Could be a bit more transparency.

pros: Nice people are there so there’s that

title: Be Careful

cons: They treat their employees terribly. Micromanagement is prevalent. A lot of favoritism happening as well.
